name: Another title for this reading could be _____.

options.A: The Life of the Thorny Devil

name: Why did Andrew Parker go to the Australian desert?

options.A: to capture and bring back a thorny devil
options.B: to understand how the thorny devil collects water
options.C: to provide water to thirsty thorny devils
options.D: to discover water in the Australian desert

name: What has the study of termite nests inspired?
In line 90, what does things refer to?
According to the article, which is a limitation of Stickybot?

options.A: It can’t climb up rough surfaces.
options.B: It can move forward but not backward.
options.C: It’s too heavy to stay on a wall for long.
options.D: The military won’t let others use the technology.

name: What is the main idea of paragraph 8 (starting line 124)?

options.A: Velcro is the greatest business success biomimetics has ever had.
options.B: Biomimetics would be more successful if industry were less demanding.
options.C: Nature’s complexity is why biomimetics has had few business successes.
options.D: Today’s engineers are unable to copy nature as well as de Mestral could.

name: Which of these statements about biomimetics is NOT true?

options.A: Parker hopes to create a water-collection device inspired by the thorny devil.
options.B: Studying humpback whale fins may be useful for improving windmills.
options.C: The body of a fish inspired a car design.
options.D: Stickybot is perhaps the most famous biomimetic creation so far.

name: What is the main purpose of the passage?

options.A: to provide a historical overview of innovative fashion styles
options.B: to introduce the reader to developments in high-tech textiles
options.C: to convince the reader to buy the latest synthetic fashions
options.D: to explain how modern fashions are often inspired by nature

name: Why does Huges Vinchon mention a motorboat you can’t hear?

options.A: to evoke admiration for a fabric that can absorb vibrations
options.B: to explain one of the properties of an oil-absorbing fabric
options.C: to give an example of how quietly his textile factory runs
options.D: to show that he is not afraid of having his ideas stolen

name: Which person do you think would be most likely to design a coat made of paper with six sleeves that three people can wear together?
Which of these items has actually been sold in stores?
What does Clive van Heerden mean, when talking about the jacket, that “it’s not going to happen overnight”? (lines 104–105)

options.A: It’s not going to happen until tomorrow.
options.B: It’s going to take a short time to happen.
options.C: It’s going to take a long time to happen.
options.D: It’s probably never going to happen.

name: The word they in line 127 refers to _____.
The following sentence would best be placed at the end of which paragraph? Thanks to them, the world of high-tech textiles is an exciting place to be these days.
